clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study Between Lap. Dual Approach, Lap. Trans Abdominal Pre-peritoneal and Lichtenstein Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Inguinal Hernioplasty: Comparative Study Between Laparoscopic Dual Approach, Laparoscopic Trans Abdominal Preperitoneal and Lichtenstein Procedures. A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study designed to compare the new laparoscopic dual approach to inguinal hernia repair with trans-abdominal preperitoneal (TAPP) and lichtenstein repair (open procedure)

detailed_description.textblock: inguinal hernioplasty is a procedures where synthetic mesh is used to strengthen the inguinal tissues sites for hernia repair different methods used which is either anterior approach (open Lichtenstein) or laparoscopic posterior approach through the abdomen (TAPP) comparing these two methods by new approach which is considered to some extent a modified TAPP by pneumo-dissection of pre-peritoneal space with abdominal approach by lap. repair

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: comparative study between three procedures of inguinal hernioplasty; open (LICHTENSTEIN), TAPP, and laparoscopic DUAL APPROACH (modified TAPP)
study_design_info.masking_description: this is a randomized trial where the participants are selected randomly to each of the previous three groups , and the post operative assessment of complication and pain done by different surgical residents whom are not informed about the groups of study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the inflation of the abdomen till deflation and port closure ---for lichtenstein from skin incision to skin closure.
primary_outcome.description: operative time will be measured in minutes for each procedure.and comparing three groups ( dual approach , TAPP and Lichtenstein ) in operative time which determined as follow: from the inflation of the abdomen till deflation and port closure for Lichtenstein from skin incision to skin closure

secondary_outcome.description: abdominal visceral injuries cord structure injuries
mild bleeding and oozing controlled by cautery bleeding from inferior epigastric artery or testicular artery major vascular injury

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately post operative and 6 ,12, 24 hours and two weeks post operative
secondary_outcome.description: pain measured by visual analog scale from 0 no pain to 10 the worst pain ever.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post operative ,3 ,6 and 12 months postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: wound seroma , hematoma either small with conservative treatment and large need intervention wound infection either superficial skin and S.C. or mesh infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: follow up at 3 months , 6 months and one year for pain assessment by VAS
secondary_outcome.description: post operative paraesthesia , bricking pain, dull-aching pain. measured by visual analog scale (VAS) from 0 no pain to 10 the worst pain ever
post operative inguinal swelling confirmed clinically as a recurrent hernia

arm_group.description: dual approach laparoscopic inguinal hernioplasty by combination of TAPP (group B) and pneumo-dissection preperitoneal instead of sharp dissection
trans-abdominal preperitoneal hernioplasty (TAPP) after induction of pneumoperitoneum through peritoneal approach peritoneal incision and preperitoneal dissection then mesh fixation done
open inguinal hernioplasty (lichtenstein) repair through inguinal incision and dissection of the sac anteriorly , excision of the sac and then mesh fixation in the posterior wall of inguinal canal

intervention.description: after pneumoperitoneum is done preperitoneal pneumo-dissection is done and then peritoneal incision done . dissection preperitoneally and sac dissection will be easy approached
pneumoperitoneum is done and then through abdominal approach peritoneal dissection in done and sac reduction and then mesh fixation
inguinal incision is done and inguinal canal approach anteriorly and then sac dissection and excision then mesh fixation to posterior wall and closure the incision in layers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult male patient (older than 18y).
- Not complicated.
- No previous lower abdominal incisions (lower abdominal midline and lower paramedian incision in the same side of hernia).
- No contraindication for general anesthesia.
- Not recurrent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- any one not in fulfill inclusion criteria
